There are no disease entities mentioned in the paragraph. The paragraph discusses antiretroviral therapy (ART) and CD4+ T-cells, but neither of these are diseases. Antiretroviral therapy is a treatment for HIV, and CD4+ T-cells are a type of white blood cell that are important for the immune system. However, they are not diseases themselves.

After reevaluating the paragraph, I realized that only "antiretroviral therapy ( ART )" is a chemical entity. "Alcohol" is not a chemical but a beverage; however, in this context, it refers to ethanol, an alcohol compound. Nonetheless, since the word "alcohol" is not used to specifically refer to ethanol, I will only list "antiretroviral therapy ( ART )" as a chemical entity.
